page.title: 10LOCAL GOVERNMENT - PARISH
page.content: Hodnet Parish Council was formed ninety-one years ago, on the 4th of December 1894.Thirteen local residents were elected, Major Algernon Heber- Percy being Chairman. The Precept then was Â£40 per Annum, and Parish Councils were responsible for the{Fire Brigade wages which were Â£4.16s 0d yearly. Now there are 11 members with a Precept of Â£4000. Responsibility for the Fire Brigade now lies with the County Council.{Elections}are held every four years. Parish Council are the "grass roots" of local government ensuring that views of residents are taken into account by the district and County Councils. Hodnet Parish Council are Trustees for the{Recreation {Ground}and the{Lyon Hall}which was commenced in 1913 and opened in 1921. This is the social centre of the village. Mrs.Barbara Bate. Secretary.
